content:
I think there might be some confusion! While it's great that your friend is trying to help, the train fare from Narita Airport to Shinjuku Station is not around $10.

The cheapest train option from Narita Airport to Shinjuku Station would be the Keisei Electric Railway's commuter train, which takes around 80-90 minutes and costs around ¥1,000-1,200 (around $9-11 USD) one way. However, this option involves multiple transfers and is not the most convenient.

The more convenient options, like the Narita Express (N'EX) or the Keisei Skyliner, cost around ¥3,020 (around $28 USD) and ¥2,520 (around $23 USD) one way, respectively. These trains are faster and more comfortable, but also more expensive.

It's possible that your friend might have gotten the prices mixed up or was referring to a different route or mode of transportation. If you're looking for a budget-friendly option, I can help you explore other choices, such as the bus or a private car service.

However, if you're willing to splurge a bit, the Narita Express or Keisei Skyliner are great options that will get you to your hotel in Shinjuku quickly and comfortably.

Would you like me to help you explore other options or provide more information on the train routes?
